title: Protests Erupt in Shanghai and Other Chinese Cities Over Covid Controls
description: In Shanghai, a crowd chanted calls for China’s leader, Xi Jinping, to step down, a rare act of political defiance reflecting growing public frustration with his “zero Covid” demands.

title: U.S. Allows Chevron to Expand Energy Operations in Venezuela
description: The license, limited in scope, was issued amid the resumption of talks between the Venezuelan government and opposition, and comes as President Nicolás Maduro desperately needs to improve the economy.

title: Meet the Man on a Mission to Expose Sneaky Price Increases
description: Edgar Dworsky has become the go-to expert on “shrinkflation,” when products or packaging are manipulated so people get less for their money.

title: This Country’s Top Judges Were All Foreigners. Now They’re Gone.
description: The president’s suspension of five jurists in the Pacific nation of Kiribati highlights the outsize role noncitizen judges play in the region.

title: At Least 1 Dead in Landslide on a Southern Italian Island
description: Officials estimated that 10 people were missing after the landslide on the island of Ischia, a popular tourist destination off the coast of Naples.

title: Russia’s Strikes Draw Comparisons to Holodomor as Ukraine Marks Famine Anniversary
description: The Holodomor commemoration came as President Vladimir V. Putin was accused of using missile strikes on Ukraine’s power grid to freeze the country into submission.

title: Holiday Rituals
description: The season is a time of customs, of traditions repeated year after year.

title: Tech Turmoil Complicates Canada’s Policing of the Online World
description: The government has four bills before Parliament to reign in tech giants at a time when the industry is retrenching.

title: They Were Surrogates. Now They Must Raise the Children.
description: In Cambodia’s weak legal system, surrogacy exists in a gray market, endangering all involved when political conditions suddenly shift and criminal charges follow.

title: A Timely Biography Traces Joseph Roth’s Accounts of Fascism
description: Roth was an outraged witness to tyranny, which led him to exile, and his books to the bonfire. In “Endless Flight,” Keiron Pim examines the flawed man and his resonant legacy.

title: Happy Birthday, Omicron
description: One year after the variant’s discovery, virologists are still scrambling to keep up with Omicron’s rapid evolution.

title: Canadian Singer Kris Wu Sentenced to Prison for Rape in China
description: Before his arrest over #MeToo allegations, Kris Wu was one of China’s most popular entertainers, with legions of fans and brand deals.

title: U.S. and NATO Scramble to Arm Ukraine and Refill Their Own Arsenals
description: The West thought an artillery and tank war in Europe would never happen again and shrunk weapons stockpiles. It was wrong.
